Recently, I have successfully connected srsUE to OAI eNB and Amarisoft MME.

Amarisoft MME

Amarisoft MME is a commercial EPC for LTE. It’s homepage is http://www.amarisoft.com/.

OAI eNB

OAI is an opensource SDR LTE project, in which the evolved node B (eNB), user equipment (UE) and evolved packet core (EPC) are being fully developed according to the 3GPP specification. Through our test, we find that the OAI eNB is trusty. However, the OAI EPC is hard to configure and the OAI UE is unstable to some extent. The source code and tutorials can be get from https://gitlab.eurecom.fr/oai/openairinterface5g

srsUE

srsUE is an opensource SDR UE for LTE Release 8. The srsUE is very stable and trusty through our test. It’s homepage is http://www.softwareradiosystems. and you can get its source code from https://github.com/srsLTE/srsUE and http://github.com/srsLTE/srsLTE.

Joint Test

As a result, we select Amarisoft MME, OAI eNB and srsUE to develop our stable SDR LTE system. Finally, we have successfully connected srsUE to OAI eNB and Amarisoft MME.

The screenshot is as follows.

The screenshot of Amarisoft MME. As we can see, the srsUE is registered.

The screenshot of OAI eNB. As we can see, the uplink is stable.

The screenshot of srsUE. As we can see, the downlink is stable too.

The screenshot of Amarifot MME, OAI eNB and srsUE.
